REALIGNMENT CRITERIA
================================================================================

Realign templates folder when ANY of the following occur:

MANDATORY REALIGNMENT TRIGGERS:
  [ ] New template added to folder
  [ ] Template structure changed significantly
  [ ] Standards update affecting template design
  [ ] Template deprecated or removed
  [ ] Document keying standard changes (CWS-STD-002)
  [ ] Breaking changes to 4-block structure (CWS-STD-001)

RECOMMENDED REALIGNMENT TRIGGERS:
  [ ] 30 days since last alignment (scheduled maintenance)
  [ ] Minor template improvements or clarifications
  [ ] New usage examples needed
  [ ] Template thinking guidance enhanced
  [ ] Cross-references need updating
  [ ] New template category needed

OPTIONAL REALIGNMENT TRIGGERS:
  [ ] Minor wording improvements
  [ ] Typo corrections
  [ ] Comment clarifications
  [ ] Updated examples

================================================================================
ALIGNMENT PROCESS
================================================================================

When performing realignment:

STEP 1: ASSESS TRIGGERS
  - Read this file completely
  - Note which triggers occurred
  - Determine urgency (mandatory > recommended > optional)
  - Review template usage since last alignment

STEP 2: REVIEW TEMPLATES
  - Check each template file still current
  - Verify structure follows latest standards
  - Test that instructions are clear
  - Ensure thinking guidance is helpful

STEP 3: REVIEW README.MD
  - Check template inventory
  - Verify usage instructions
  - Update examples if needed
  - Fix broken links

STEP 4: UPDATE CONTENT
  - Apply standards consistently
  - Update thinking guidance
  - Add new templates
  - Mark deprecated templates
  - Fix issues discovered

STEP 5: VALIDATE
  - Test template usage (can you follow it?)
  - Check all cross-references work
  - Verify standards compliance
  - Review with fresh eyes

STEP 6: DOCUMENT ALIGNMENT
  - Update "Aligned as of" date
  - Set next scheduled check (30 days)
  - Update focus areas for next time
  - Add entry to alignment history

STEP 7: SYNCHRONIZE
  - Ensure consistency with standards/ folder
  - Cross-reference with root ALIGNMENT-STATUS.txt
  - Update workspace INDEX.md if needed
  - Note any divergence requiring discussion

COMMON ALIGNMENT SCENARIOS

SCENARIO: New template created
  Priority: MANDATORY
  Actions:
    - Add to template inventory (ALIGNMENT-STATUS.txt)
    - Add to README.md with description
    - Verify follows Kingdom Technology standards
    - Update template count/categories
    - Test template usage

SCENARIO: Standard updated (CWS-STD-001/002/003)
  Priority: MANDATORY
  Actions:
    - Review all templates for compliance
    - Update affected templates
    - Update thinking guidance if needed
    - Document changes in alignment history

SCENARIO: Template usage reveals improvement opportunity
  Priority: MEDIUM
  Actions:
    - Update template with clearer guidance
    - Add example if helpful
    - Improve thinking comments
    - Document in alignment notes

SCENARIO: Template no longer needed
  Priority: MEDIUM
  Actions:
    - Mark as deprecated in ALIGNMENT-STATUS.txt
    - Update README.md to reflect status
    - Consider if should be removed or archived
    - Document reason for deprecation

SCENARIO: 30-day check without major changes
  Priority: LOW (unless drift detected)
  Actions:
    - Verify all templates still current
    - Check cross-references still work
    - Confirm standards alignment
    - Update if minor improvements needed

NOTES
================================================================================

Templates serve the entire CreativeWorkzStudio workspace. They're not just
fill-in-the-blank forms - they include thinking guidance to help apply
Kingdom Technology principles intentionally.

Templates should:
  - Follow Kingdom Technology standards exactly
  - Include helpful thinking guidance comments
  - Serve all understanding levels (starting → advanced)
  - Demonstrate excellence through clarity
  - Be tested through actual use

The 30-day check is a safety net. If templates need updates due to standards
changes or usage feedback, realign immediately.

Templates are living documents - improve them based on experience and feedback.
